attributes.action: Make 8th May 'Attenborough Day' - a bank holiday for visiting nature.
attributes.background: Sir David Attenborough is one of the greatest Britons of the past 100 years. Rather than putting him on a plastic bank note or a commemorative coin, mark his Birthday with a public holiday for getting into nature and cleaning up our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Doing good things, especially outside, makes people happier. Happier people make happier workers means greater production. It’s a win win.

attributes.action: Give people needing intimate care a right to have it by carers of the same sex
attributes.background: I am concerned that some vulnerable and/or elderly people needing intimate personal care, in their own homes or in care homes are having to suffer the indignity of intimate care several times a day, every day and have no right to refuse to have it carried out by someone of the opposite gender.
attributes.additional_details:
My elderly mother was refused her request to have 2 ladies attend her intimate care by a local care agency.  Luckily for her I was able to assist and ensure the male carer wait in the hall.  
It is not currently a right to have someone of the same gender attend to intimate care.  I think it should be.

attributes.action: Apology from British government for 1919 Jallianwala Bagh Massacre in India
attributes.background: On 13 April 1919, Col R. Dyer of British Indian Army ordered soldiers to fire onto a crowd of pilgrims gathered in Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar, India to celebrate the holy festival of Baishakhi. Dyer got all exits blocked to deliver maximum fatality killing hundreds of innocent unarmed civilians
attributes.additional_details:
Well documented incident which is the worst among many crimes committed by the colonising British. The pre-planned massacre puts the official deaths as 387. Dyer admitted that 1650 rounds were fired into a trapped crowd including elderly, kids and women. Unofficially casualties are estimated to be over 1000.

On the centenary of this horrific crime, the british government must tender an apology to the people of India in 2019

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jallianwala_Bagh_massacre#The_massacre

attributes.action: Update the current legislation: "The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989"
attributes.background: There exists ambiguity within the electrical industry, specifically with regard to electrical installation of equipment, with what can be considered acceptable with regard to meeting the requirements of regulations, due to the outdated and generic criteria which is open to interpretation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EaWR 1989 would benefit from an update to specifically clarify and reference the associated standards and regulations detailed below:

The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989

The Electrical Equipment (Safety) Regulations 2016

BS 7671

BS 6423

This would ensure that persons on whom duties are imposed (e.g. duty holders) have a clear and defined defence against any alleged breaches.

attributes.action: To allow Tyler, the Creator back into the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In 2015, Tyler, the Creator (an American rapper) was banned from the United Kingdom on “behaviours unacceptable in the UK.” People make mistakes especially at a young age. What Tyler promotes is music which people adore and has matured as most people do. He's been banned from lyrics he wrote in 2009
attributes.additional_details: Tyler has changed as seen in his new music and album released in 2017, which is appealing to at least many thousands of fans in the United Kingdom and does not promote violence as he does not ever promote or perform those songs. His punishment has been too extreme for someone who has used ill lyrics at a poor time which many other celebrities have used worse. The people of the United Kingdom want to see him perform again.

attributes.action: Continue benefit payments while processing Universal Credit
attributes.background: UC is the total of all benefits that a person will claim. Once UC has been processed, and the amount payable is known, then deduct or add accordingly HB/CT/ESA etc. with the remainder being the claimant's entitlement. This will prevent risking lives/ homes or the need for food banks in the meantime.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for food products to have carbon print and water usage labels
attributes.background:
The current rate of climate change is having devastating effects on the planet with natural disasters becoming more commonplace.
Some food products are much more carbon and water intensive in production than others and having these labels will allow us to be more informed.
attributes.additional_details:
With around 10% of the UK’s carbon emissions in 2016 coming from domestic agriculture https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/679334/2016_Final_Emissions_Statistics_one_page_summary.pdf
we should consider ways in which to reduce this.

Companies like Tesco once opted to add carbon labels to some food products on a voluntary basis; however, they then dropped this policy in part due to other retailers failing to follow suit.

attributes.action: Free prescription charges in England
attributes.background:
Why should people in England be charged for prescriptions?
Why can the rest of the "United Kingdom" be exempt the same as Wales Scotland, Northern Ireland.
This is direct discrimination against anyone living in England.

attributes.action: Protect property sellers by introducing 'conclusion of missives' contracts
attributes.background: In Scotland you cannot back out of a house sale once 'missives are concluded', yet this is not the same in England. This will raise confidence for sellers and save any last minute dissapointments which costs the seller time, money, uncertainty and stress.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently I have had a buyer pull out of our sale 2 weeks before completion which, unless i can find a new buyer quickly, means we will lose the house we planned to buy, our deposit and all of the upfront fees we paid coming to almost £2000.
A lot of people have been in the same situation costing families thousands of pounds that they cannot afford to lose. If we introduce laws such as Scotlands, home sellers have more protection against buyers pulling out at the last minute with no repercussions

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke within 10 metres of a dwelling if it is hotter than 25C
attributes.background: In the summer, due to global warming, temperatures now regularly reach 30 - 35C. This is extremely hot and it is simply insulting to expect people to not open their windows because inconsiderate people are smoking outside their house.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hugely affected by this issue. Smokers pollute the environment and contribute to global warming. They also severely harm others with second hand smoke, especially children. 
Children are often unable to play in the garden in the summer due to the noxious gases being emitted from the smoke, this causes a deficiency in vitamin D. This law will apply to all areas (public or residential) unless the owner of the properties affected allows them to smoke. Penalty: £400 - 6 months

attributes.action: OFSTED to closely monitor training qualifications provided by care organisations
attributes.background: All care companies should have, their training programmes Ofsted inspected, and assessors to hold the minimum of a teaching degree.
attributes.additional_details: Currently care companies, self regulate their in house training programmes. This leaves their training programmes wide open not only to educational fraud, but also the substandard delivery and assessment of  in-house training programmes. Each in-house training programme should also lead to a nationally recognised qualification. Which should be standardised internally and externally.

attributes.action: Give parents paid leave for school closure/sickness for their children
attributes.background: I find it ever so unfair when you work hard to support your children, children are far more likely to pick up bugs and illnesses, parent should not have to lose pay or take holiday to cover the time off to look their child it should paid by the employer
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was recently admitted into hospital, she was there for a week, I had to take it as holiday because i would lose a lot of money if I took it as sick.... firstly I’m not sick and secondly it’s not a holiday, I should be entitled to get paid time off for my child care, but it must be proven time off obviously, I however took it as holiday as I had no choice, this I feel is unfair as you should no be punished for a child sickness, I would work if I was ill, but children are different

attributes.action: Review the unfair school fine system where 2 parent families pay twice
attributes.background: The penalty for taking a child out of school is on a per person, per child basis. This means two parent families have to pay the fine twice. This is unfair and should be reviewed.

attributes.action: NHS & Social Care Services to adopt the Edith Ellen Foundation Kindness Charter.
attributes.background: As there is little evidence of improvements in addressing unsafe and poor care services, the Government should aim for one standardised quality of care everyone can trust by requiring the NHS and social care providers to adopt this charter.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.edithellenfoundation.org/the-kindness-charter/

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a legal requirement to increase voting turnout
attributes.background: Making voting a legal requirement will increase the turnout, making more uk citizens happier with the results. Currently, only 60% of the registered voters take part, which leaves 40% unhappy with the turnout as that have not cast a vote. We would like to change this and make voting compulsory.

attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: Food labelling re sugar to simple & straight forward for all
attributes.background:
I believe all foodstuffs should just have a picture of a spoon of  sugar with a number on it denoting the amount in total in that product.
There are too many guises for sugar that consumers do not understand.

attributes.action: The cost of a colour TV licence should be cut to £100.
attributes.background:
BBC news and current affairs programmes are no longer of high quality.
In an age of austerity where ordinary people are struggling to make ends meet, a licence fee of £150 is no longer justified for substandard broadcasting.
attributes.additional_details:
As a national broadcaster, the BBC is expected to be fearless, objective and impartial in its reporting of news and current affairs programming.
The BBC often avoids or downplays politically sensitive news items, allows statements to go unchallenged and uses false equivalence to counter balance expert opinion.
These are not the attributes expected of a national broadcaster in a leading democratic nation.

attributes.action: Build all M53 bridges with anti climb fencing
attributes.background: All bridges crossing the M53 should have new fences built across them so people are unable to climb up and over them.
attributes.additional_details: How many more lives must be lost or risked because motorway bridges are built with fences that can be climbed? This is happening all too often and is so easily preventable.

attributes.action: Offer support to Greece regarding the Mati Wildfire Crisis
attributes.background: The Mati wildfire has burned through village, causing 74 fatalities so far, with that number "expected to rise", and with little control over the fire. The United Kingdom should offer assistance in the form of firefighters, aircraft and vehicles to assist the struggling victims of the fire.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.reviewjournal.com/news/nation-and-world/death-toll-from-greece-fires-reaches-74-is-expected-to-rise/amp/

attributes.action: Make the penalties for breaking election rules far stronger
attributes.background:
Vote Leave breaking electoral law in the referendum is the latest in a string of electoral scandals. 

The fines are so small as to be seen as a reasonable cost to parties and campaign groups. Penalties should include greater fines, prison and even annulment of results.

attributes.action: Ban Staples From Newspapers
attributes.background: Staples are an unnecessary addition to newspapers which are an environmental liability - this petition asks the government to ban the use of staples in newspaper production.
attributes.additional_details:
Staples are for the most part made using steel which is produced with the requirement of a blast furnace and this using large amounts of energy. No staples would also mean that newspapers would be more easily recyclable due to the absence of metal and the decay of newspapers would be much increased.
Banning staples would bring down production costs for newspaper companies And would create a safer environment in factories.

attributes.action: Ban the use of fireworks unless it’s a controlled and / or organised event
attributes.background: Fireworks are great but can cause unnecessary harm to both humans and animals. Fireworks are being used all year round although amazing they should be used at controlled events. Pets are often very frightened by them. A local pet slipped his lead recently and sadly passed away due to being run over
attributes.additional_details: If you know there is going to be a display you can be prepared for this but people are randomly setting fireworks off at all times of the year.   This has to stop. Also the elderly are often very anxious when hearing the loud banging and people  with dementia too.   Shops should get on board too with when they are to be sold. A government ruling needs to be actioned. The public could still be able to purchase but a ruling to say that only for Events, Firework Night and New Year etc.

attributes.action: Government to urge all countries ban trophy hunting.
attributes.background: I believe the UK Government should put all the pressure it can to make Trophy Hunting illegal worldwide. If we do not do something magnificent creatures will be lost for future generations. I would also like to be illegal to kill a similar creature in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: Trophy hunters are killing 70,000 animals ever year.

attributes.action: Support the 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' to regulate nurdle handling
attributes.background: Nurdles are small plastic pellets used in the production of plastic products.  Due to poor handling and lack of regulation, nurdles have become a huge source of pollution to our oceans and waterways.  Visit https://cans.blog to see more.
attributes.additional_details: Once spilt into marine environments nurdles absorb toxic chemicals and pose an immediate danger to wildlife as their size makes them easily mistaken for food.  The 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' has written a piece of secondary legislation that specifies methods to regulate all nurdle handling in the UK and UK waters.  This legislation will force anyone handling over 2KG of nurdles to be registered and agree to the highest standards of care when handling nurdles.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of Pyrotechnics at UK football grounds
attributes.background: The majority of countries within Europe and South America allow fans to use pyrotechnics such as smoke bombs and flares at football matches however current law states that in UK they are not allowed and the use of them can lead to stadium bans as well as custodial sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Football banning orders for use of pyrotechnics are at minimum 3 years through a court and can go up to 10 years. Even if you are caught with the smoke bomb in a bag search, the punishments can be just as harsh as if you had let it off.

attributes.action: All Mainstream Schools should have the resources to teach deaf children.
attributes.background: Pupils with special needs have a basic right to a mainstream education and the increased opportunity for social interaction with their peers that this brings. Mainstream participation allows everybody the opportunity to learn to understand the diversity of human ability, without prejudice.
attributes.additional_details:
In Manchester there are currently only 2 schools with the resource to teach deaf children. Both in the same area of Manchester, so the council pay to transport children from all over Manchester to these 2 schools. To clarify 'resource' is a room where a teacher for the deaf can do some quiet work with the deaf children. 
There are new schools being built all the time, surely this is a perfect opportunity to add the resource bases the schools need. The deaf teachers are already here and trained.

attributes.action: lift the flight ban to sharm el sheikh
attributes.background: we have had wonderful holidays in sharm el sheikh,  It is time for this ridiculous ban to be ended and to help the egyptians in sharm to get back on their feet. It seems all other countries are now able to fly direct to sharm except the uk, please lift the ban.

attributes.action: Create a government virtual address for homeless people to use as fixed abode.
attributes.background: Homeless people are prevented from progressing with services and employment opportunities due to no fixed address.

attributes.action: All local authorities should recycle all plastic
attributes.background: Torridge and West Devon do not currently allow recycling of anything other than plastic bottles. All other plastic is sent to landfill. In a joined up world how can it be that other Councils can recycle all plastic and others can only recycle some.
attributes.additional_details: Surely we should have a joined up approach to recycling ALL waste, particularly all plastic. Each council should adhere to a national recycling standard where all plastic is sent to be recycled. Economies of scale would make this more feasible rather than individual councils negotiating their own recycling schemes.

attributes.action: Amend Highway Code to include guidance for pothole avoidance
attributes.background: With the increasing number of unmarked dangerous defects in our road surfaces nationwide, there is no guidance in the Highway Code regarding a safe approach. Does one brake sharply, swerve, or proceed over the defect rendering your vehicle or motorcycle uncontrollable and potentially damaged?

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence not to report child abuse
attributes.background: If children report abuse to an adult, including a family member, that adult must be required by law to report it to the police. Too many families choose to keep quiet to protect their (family) honour and/ or careers and let the defenceless child suffer.

attributes.action: Free Prescriptions for all under 25s in full time education
attributes.background: It is currently free for full time students aged 18 and under to get prescription medication. I’ve just turned 19 and will now have to pay for my medication whilst being a full time university student, so it may become that I cannot afford it every month and forfeit my health due to financial issues
attributes.additional_details: Many students may not see their gp due to this. I think that a valid student ID should give exemption to paying for prescriptions when being a first time student. The age limit needs raising from 18 to 25 to account for this.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: Make Staffordshire Bull terriers wear a harness or muzzle in public.
attributes.background:
My pet cat was savaged and killed by a Staffordshire bull terrier whilst the incompetent owner and his partner walked past my premises. 
The dog was not muzzled or in a harness, he was able to slip his lead and collar. The owner who had one arm in a sling at the time was unable to control him.
attributes.additional_details:
I am partially disabled and Ben is my only companion, this has had a devastating effect on my life. 
I reported the incident to the police and the Basildon Echo. 
The police are unable to do anything about it without identifying the owner. 
I have searched the neighbourhood and spoken with many local people but have been unable to find the owner. 
My MP encouraged me to start the petition and has spoken with the police on my behalf.

attributes.action: Give students free dental care and prescriptions on the NHS
attributes.background: Most students do not have any income, or if they do it is very minimal. Most students cannot afford dental treatment or prescriptions and avoid going to the doctors or dentist. This can mean that medical problems can go untreated and thus cost the NHS more in the long term.

attributes.action: Introduce a statue of limitations for Army veterans
attributes.background: British Army veterans are being investigated for alleged wrongdoings that took place over 40 years ago in Northern Ireland , even though in many cases they were thoroughly investigated at the time . The introduction of a statute of limitations would prevent this from happening in the future .

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable plastics, plastic toys  & plastic bags in the UK.
attributes.background:
According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics.
More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050.”
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother of 2 young children I feel now is the time to #endplasticuse4good.
I travelled to Kenya recently and I was surprised to discover that they have banned the use of plactic bags and so on.
We MUST all take action now to save our planet. Please support this petition!
The toy companies must be accountable and be charged for making plastic toys that are easily disposable!

attributes.action: Ban discrimination in private rental sector towards people on benefits
attributes.background: It’s become increasingly difficult to find a letting agent/ landlord that will accept people on low incomes with top up benefits. The Government should have some input on this due to the lack of council properties available to those in need.
attributes.additional_details: I have been searching for a 2 bedroom property for myself and my daughter for a few months and the stumbling block is always the fact that I receive working/child tax credit and housing benefit. This in my opinion is discriminatory towards those on low incomes who need that extra help because they are not in a position to work full time.

attributes.action: Pass a law to prevent landlords refusing people to have pets.
attributes.background: We request you pass a law that forbids landlords to deny tenants a pet as it will prove beneficial for people and animals alike.
attributes.additional_details: Having pets has been proved to be very beneficial for health, lowering blood pressure, helping with stress etc. For people living alone they are companionship. For children, it educates them about caring and having compassion for other living creatures along with responsibility of such. With so many animal shelters full, the problem is being exhasperated by private landlords denying people a basic right to have a pet. For time immemorial people have kept animals as pets and surely it is within their human rights to do so.

attributes.action: Prevent absent parents from travelling outside the UK if maintenance is unpaid
attributes.background: Recently Australia enforced action against parents with child support debts from travelling in and out of the country until they had settled their arrears. Introducing a similar law into the UK would benefit many UK families and make absent parents face up to their responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/may/27/child-support-debts-record-number-of-parents-prevented-from-travelling-overseas

attributes.action: Change CMS from GROSS pay back to NET pay and don't include a fathers overtime.
attributes.background: The child support agency (CSA) has changed over to the child maintainance service (CMS) and in doing so it has changed calculations from NET PAY to GROSS PAY costing dads anywhere from £50 extra per month to 200+ extra per month, as these new calculations also include overtime.
attributes.additional_details: Also take into account the mental state this can have on a father. We are trying to prevent problems, not create more.

attributes.action: Revoke the right of the OfS to share data with private entities without consent.
attributes.background: The Office of Students Is a government approved body to help regulate the higher education sector. This authority holds information pertaining to mental and physical health, academic progress And graduate employment and earning. This information is being shared with private entities like Pearson.
attributes.additional_details: http://defenddigitalme.com/2018/06/student-data-rights-packaged-up-for-pearson/

attributes.action: Prohibit the manafacture and commercial distribution of cigarettes within the UK
attributes.background:
Ever hour around the world, 800 people die as a result of the most lethal human creation - cigarettes. These small paper rolls kill more people on average around the globe than AK47's

So why is it so ironic that countries prohibit smoking in public but still allow toxic tobacco manufacturing ?
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 4 million hectares of deforestation for cigarette fuels and paper wrapping.

This industry kills 7 million people ever year

So why can we as humans not recognise that this substance would be better off if completely irradicated. Why is it seen as though the manafacturers care more about their profits than the health of people around the globe. 

And unfortunately, "smoking kills" just isn't enough.

attributes.action: Make law to link all new vehicles' EMS to their Sat-Nav, to limit their speed.
attributes.background:
Vehicular Sat-Nav systems already receive data relating to the speed limit of a vehicle's location, and should be connected to each one's EMS, so it can automatically limit its speed.
• Emergency vehicles would be exempt (for obvious reasons)
• A criminal offence to circumvent the technology
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UK suffered 3,064 accidents attributable to speed, in which people were either killed or seriously injured. The technology now exists that can make the roads safer.

attributes.action: Offer free life and employability skills to young offenders.
attributes.background: With the alarming increase in youth violence, it is crucial to not only prevent it spreading- but to help those already involved. A criminal record can lessen the chance of employment, and without being taught necessary skills and given support those young people may fall back into their old ways.
attributes.additional_details: Article 26 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights state that we have a right to education, and educating young offenders on ways in which they can turn their lives around and overcome all adversities is better than any national curriculum.

attributes.action: Make the House of Lords appointment process fully independent from government.
attributes.background: Peers are appointed by the Queen on the prime minister's advice. Some members are recommended by an independent body, called the House of Lords Appointments Commission, but only for non-party-political individuals. This process allows government to tip the balance in the Lords for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
The government's power to select members of the House of Lords, leaves the Chamber open to unethical appointments, for example the recent selection made by Prime Minister Theresa May, which appears to be an attempt at quelling opposing voices inside government: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-44167066
This should never be allowed. A fully independent body must be set up to elect peers to the House of Lords.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to allow your dog to have access to your letterbox
attributes.background: Dog attacks are on the increase. Many bites happen when items are pushed through letterboxes. I feel it should be the law to either have a box fitted externally, a box fitted internally so a dog can’t get to the letterbox or the dog inaccessible to the back of the front door (behind internal door).
attributes.additional_details:
I have worked as a postman and also as a courier and have seen and heard so many stories of dog bites due to delivering mail, parcels or a ‘left with neighbour card’. Recently a person lost their finger due to posting a card through a letterbox. Bringing this law in would stop these needless and sometimes life changing injuries. Something needs to be addressed and sooner rather than later. 
Please sign this petition. Thank you.

attributes.action: Allow voluntary Lie Detector Tests in criminal trials for both victims & accused
attributes.background: I’m a crime victim & have experienced the horrific tactics adopted by defence barristers determined to get perpetrators off regardless of guilt. I propose, in the interest of fairness, that both accused & victims can voluntarily submit to lie detector tests & that this evidence can be used at trial.
attributes.additional_details:
Lie detectors are now used on convicted sex offenders to manage risk, but not allowed in criminal trials. The guilty walk free as juries are often reluctant to convict. Lie detectors, offered to both sides, should be allowed as partial evidence 
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/02/16/liedetectorshave-used-send-160-sex-offenders-back-prison/
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/britains-hostility-to-lie-detector-tests-misguided-and-irrational-says-leading-psychologist-10349313.html
